Articles.Content:
This is not the first car I've made, but it's the one I'm the most satisfied with so far. As for the name, maybe the engineer had a cold or something while naming it. Who knows.

Anyway, the Jeeb is a classic 4x4 jeep, inspired by the Willys WW2 one. Seats four kerbals, has about 130 parts, and weighs roughly 4 tons. It also features extendable landing legs for taking the weight off a particular wheel when repairing it, as it will break immediately otherwise. The four kerbals are not included, but it can drive itself since it has a probe core as well. I had to use quite a lot of part clipping to make it, so if you don't like that, then maybe the Jeeb is not your cup of tea. 100% stock parts, though.

Craft file (Mk3): https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/24407836/Jeeb%204x4%20Mk3.craft

I LOVE it!

Its so cute! And really clean design too. Well done Lunait!
I like how you use landing legs. You're genious)
The Willys MB (Jeep) is one of my favorite vehicles of all time, nice job making it in KSP.
Amazing work, I myself am still attempting to learn the finer points of detailed asthetics
I like your vehicle, but the download link just shows text rather than a downloadable file. I'd really like to try your design, though, because it might be better than the car design I'm using.

Thanks everyone! I'm glad you like it.

I like your vehicle, but the download link just shows text rather than a downloadable file. I'd really like to try your design, though, because it might be better than the car design I'm using.

.craft files are basically text files that are read by the game and converted into 3D models. If you right-click and select "Save as" you should be able to download the file.

If you send the .craft file to a compressed folder, it'll be easier to download without having to rename it as a .craft file.

It's loads of fun, but was a little frustrating to download. The text took forever to load.

I've decided the only fun way to get this to the Mun was to build an SSTO. Work in progress.

Edited July 23, 2014 by Box of Stardust
